title: How to write a grammatically correct dialogue - Quora

response.answer_text: Dialogue- exchange of speech between two characters- need not be grammatically correct, but it does have to be realistic. It needs to sound like two people talking to one another, not like words put into the mouths of characters. So before you write a word, listen to people talking: on the bus, in the park, in the office. Listen to their vocabulary and patterns of speech. Then go write your dialogue. Don't obsess about grammar.
By using inverted commas and by writing grammatically correct sentences .One has to also name the speaker of the dialogue , before using the inverted commas .
